question.body: The specialized structures found in muscle cells allow the cells to perform their functions more efficiently. Which of the following correctly describes the role of parts of a triad?

multiple_choice.choice: The T tubules create an action potential. The terminal cisternae store magnesium.
The T tubules are part of the endoplasmic reticulum a make proteins. The terminal cisternae are part of the endoplasmic reticulum that store calcium.
The T tubules store calcium. The terminal cisternae allow action potential to travel into the muscle cells.
The T tubules allow the action potential to travel into the muscle cells. The terminal cisternae store calcium.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The terminal cisternae store calcium, not the T tubules that are extensions of the sarcolemma.
Incorrect. The T tubules are part of the sarcolemma, not the endoplasmic reticulum.
Incorrect. The terminal cisternae store calcium, not the T tubules that are extensions of the sarcolemma.
Correct. The T tubules are extensions of the sarcolemma that extend into the cell to transmit the signal, and the cisternae are part of the sarcoplasmic reticulum.

part.hint: Transverse tubules are part of the sarcolemma.
